markdown:
Kothogaz is a towering horror of claws and eyes, surrounded by swarming insects. **[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 52 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 50 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 47 [Kothogaz, Dance Of Disharmony](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1730) **Source** [Monsters of Myth](/Sources.aspx?ID=107) pg. 52 **Perception** +41; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) (imprecise) 120 feet **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13); (can't speak any language) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +43, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +41, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +35 **Str** +10 **Dex** +10 **Con** +9 **Int** -3 **Wis** +8 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 49 **Fort** +32 **Ref** +39 **Will** +35 **HP** 400 , regeneration 30 **Immunities** [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [clumsy](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3), [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10), [enfeebled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [petrified](/Conditions.aspx?ID=30), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) **Resistances** [sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147) 20 **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=17)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 300 feet, DC 41
**Horrific Speed** Kothogaz is permanently [quickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=32). It can use this extra action to Stride or Strike.
**Noxious Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) 120 feet. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the emanation must succeed at a DC 41 Fortitude save or be [sickened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) (sickened 3 on a critical failure).
**Reactive** Kothogaz gains 3 reactions each round.
**Tympanic Heartbeat** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16)) 120 feet. Kothogaz's heartbeat booms like a deity's drum. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the emanation must attempt a DC 41 Will save. On a failure, its next two actions must be move actions to move at least half its Speed away from Kothogaz. A creature that critically succeeds is temporarily immune to tympanic heartbeat for 1 minute.
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** --- **Speed** 80 feet, fly 60 feet, swim 60 feet **Melee** jaws +39 ([reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [versatile B](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 4d8+18 piercing plus 2d12 sonic plus many-eyed blight **Melee** claw +39 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [versatile B](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 4d6+18 slashing plus 2d6 acid and [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) **Ranged** bezoar +39 ([range increment 100 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 4d8+8 bludgeoning plus 2d6 acid and many-eyed blight **Disharmonic Door** ([Teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156)) Kothogaz disappears, then bursts as a cacophonous sound from the throat of a creature within 240 feet. Kothogaz appears within reach of the creature and makes a melee Strike against it. The Strike deals an additional 2d12 sonic damage. **Many-Eyed Blight** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Virulent](/Traits.aspx?ID=162)) DC 44 Fortitude; **Stage 1** [stupefied 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37); **Stage 2** stupefied 2 and [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7); **Stage 3** stupefied 3, [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5), and [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1); **Stage 4** if you die, at the next new moon, your body splits, and your viscera become an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) under Kothogaz's control. **Pox the Land** ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) Kothogaz raises a pustule from the ground within 120 feet, which erupts in a 10-foot radius, 200-foot-high cylinder of cloying filth. Creatures in the area must succeed at a DC 44 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save or take 6d10 poison damage. On a failure, they can't fly for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure); flying creatures fall safely to the ground. **Suppurating Passage** The earth festers in Kothogaz's wake. Kothogaz Strides up to its Speed. Squares through which Kothogaz passes are greater difficult terrain until the start of its next turn, and any creature that enters or begins its turn in those squares must succeed at a DC 44 Reflex save or take 4d10 poison damage and 4d10 acid damage (on a critical failure, double damage and exposed to many-eyed blight). **[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35)** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) Huge, 4d10+18 bludgeoning plus 2d12 sonic and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) while swallowed, Rupture 40
Kothogaz's Destruction Many legends exist detailing methods of Kothogaz's final destruction. The most popular story is of the [_Raga of Remembrance_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=72), a performance powerful enough to summon the spirits of the millions who opposed Kothogaz so long ago. The raga's drone builds from a disharmonic instrument crafted with pieces of the beast's heart, and once the song swells, the musician becomes an anchor for the avatar of the legendary psychic Vanitapati.
name: Kothogaz, Dance Of Disharmony

It can use this extra action to Stride or Strike. Noxious Aura (aura, poison) 120 feet. Tympanic Heartbeat (aura, auditory) 120 feet. Kothogaz's heartbeat booms like a deity's drum. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the emanation must attempt a DC 41 Will save. On a failure, its next two actions must be move actions to move at least half its Speed away from Kothogaz. A creature that critically succeeds is temporarily immune to tympanic heartbeat for 1 minute. Many-Eyed Blight (Disease, Virulent) DC 44 Fortitude; Stage 1 stupefied 2; Stage 2 stupefied 2 and dazzled; Stage 3 stupefied 3, confused, and blinded; Stage 4 if you die, at the next new moon, your body splits, and your viscera become an undead under Kothogaz's control. Creatures in the area must succeed at a DC 44 basic Reflex save or take 6d10 poison damage. Swallow Whole Single Action (Attack) Huge, 4d10+18 bludgeoning plus 2d12 sonic and clumsy 1 while swallowed, Rupture 40 Kothogaz's Destruction Many legends exist detailing methods of Kothogaz's final destruction. The most popular story is of the Raga of Remembrance , a performance powerful enough to summon the spirits of the millions who opposed Kothogaz so long ago.
